channel.title: Has the BM website been slow lately?
channel.description:
I've been experiencing very slow page loads for this websites over the past week. It wasn't due to my browser, router or Internet speed.
i needed to clear the DNS cache.
i simply opened up the 'windows command prompt' aka 'Run' and typed the following command. [quote] ipconfig /flushdns [/quote] If anybody else is experiencing similar problems, hope this helps.

item.title: Has the BM website been slow lately?
item.dc:creator: rm249
item.description:
Omega_Absolute:

EXTREME issues tonight… 404’s, 500’s (whatever those are), extreme slow downs, and a slew of other problems. Ran a test, it’s the site not my internet (all other sites work fine).

EDITZORZS:

Hmm, that’s very weird. Unless Hubi or someone else was working on the forums then I’m not quite sure what would cause that.

Edit: Oh ya, server backups start around 1AM US Eastern, chances are that when it was starting it started to use a lot of CPU (which is only natural considering its compressing a bunch of sites). The backups are about halfway done and usually finish around 10 or 11AM, if anyone is still having issues after noon or so let me know.

Read full topic

item.title: Has the BM website been slow lately?
item.dc:creator: rm249
item.description:
Everything has been fine here as well.

Dillxn:

I say, this website has more troubles than any other that I frequent. It’s a good thing that it has such a capable web / hosting staff behind it!

Well it’s not that easy keeping everything tweaked to handle the load

russilker:

Maybe we’re the soon-to-be survivors of the BMS Forum Crash of 2010?

The chances of a catastrophic crash are pretty slim. At the very most in the event of any kind of crash we might lose a week of posts. The server BMS is currently on is setup with RAID 1 config and we do weekly backups to a remote server.

Read full topic
